snippet: The leader of the Catholic Church in Ireland, Cardinal Sean Brady, said he would not step down despite new accusations he allowed a serial pedophile priest to keep his job, allowing the abuse to continue.
abstract: Cardinal Sean Brady, the leader of the Catholic Church in Ireland, says he will not resign, despite new accusations that he failed 35 years ago to alert the parents of victims of a serial pedophile priest, Brendan Smyth, allowing the abuse to continue for at least another decade.
lead_paragraph: The leader of the Catholic Church in Ireland, Cardinal Sean Brady, said he would not step down despite new accusations he allowed a serial pedophile priest to keep his job, allowing the abuse to continue.

headline.seo: Irish Cardinal Rejects New Accusations on Pedophile Priest
headline.main: Irish Cardinal Rejects New Accusations on Pedophile Priest
headline.print_headline: Ireland: Cardinal Says He Won’t Resign
